item.description:
There's no better way to spend a Sunday than with your favorite atheists in the city's best used bookstores! This event is for those of us who would consider spending a Saturday night reading a good thing.

We'll start off our version of a pub crawl at the meca of new/used bookstores...Brookline Booksmith in Coolidge Corner. We'll meet up outside and then wander around until we're ready for a late brunch at Zaftigs Deli (nothing cures a book hangover like Jewish food). Following brunch, whoever's not drunk with knowledge will continue the crawl (don't worry, the T will be our designated driver) to cap off the night at Commonwealth Books at Milk Street in Downtown Crossing.

Oh, and don't forget to pregame by clearing some space in your bookcase, you'll need it after you bag several paperbacks for way less than what Barnes and Noble would charge. Score!

Brookline Booksmith
Zaftigs Brookline
Commonwealth Books

Por favor, please update your RSVP if your plans change so we can make reservations for brunch accurately. Thanks!
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be waiting outside Brookline Booksmith at 12.
item.name: Used Bookstore Crawl
